snippet: Some lawmakers are expressing skepticism not only about the value of the domestic surveillance programs but also about the accuracy with which the administration has described them.
abstract: Some lawmakers are expressing skepticism not only about the value of National Security Agency's domestic surveillance programs but also about the accuracy with which the Obama administration has described them.
lead_paragraph: Some lawmakers are expressing skepticism not only about the value of the domestic surveillance programs but also about the accuracy with which the administration has described them.

headline.main: Lawmakers Question White House Account of an Internet Surveillance Program
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Question White House Account of an Internet Surveillance Program
